intro: Chrysothamnus nauseosus subsp. hololeucus, commonly known as yellow rabbitbrush, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and silver-gray foliage, which are adaptations to its arid environment. The plant produces small, cylindrical seed heads that are typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub habitats. Its growth form and flowering patterns make it an important component of its ecosystem.
